column1: This MS&L Railway Company site seems likely to have been part of its Sheffield and South Yorkshire Navigation system of canals and waterways, which came under MS&LR control in 1864.
MS&LR were forced to divest these canals and waterways in 1895.
MS&LR owned the Dearne and Dove Canal, which runs close to Barnsley.

The rainfall sheets give no details of the gauge location, but Junction Lock House at the point where the Dearne and Dove Canal meets the (non-MS&LR) Barnsley Canal is a possible location, and matches the 175 ft elevation given on the early rainfall sheets.
Junction Lock has been used for the grid reference given above.
The change of elevation to 317 ft in 1895 corresponds with MS&LR selling the canal, and may indicate a move of the gauge to Barnsley Court House railway station (SE346067).
